summary: This document is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York on August 5, 2019, as part of a criminal investigation into violations of federal sex trafficking and coercion statutes. It commands the production of telephone records for specific numbers from 2003-2007 and includes a request for non-disclosure to preserve the investigation's confidentiality.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Issued the grand jury subpoena and the accompanying letter requesting non-disclosure of the subpoena to preserve the confidentiality of the investigation.

persons.name: Geoff E. Berman
persons.role: United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Signed the grand jury subpoena commanding the recipient's appearance and production of records.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance Date
events.description: The date by which the subpoenaed party is commanded to appear before the grand jury or produce the requested records.

events.title: Subpoena Issuance
events.description: The date the grand jury subpoena was issued, initiating a formal demand for records related to a criminal investigation.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Borough of Manhattan, City of New York, New York
The Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The subpoena is part of an official criminal investigation into suspected felony violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking), 1594(c) (attempt/conspiracy to commit sex trafficking), and 2422(b) (coercion/enticement).
The investigation was active as of August 2019, focusing on evidence from the period January 1, 2003, through December 31, 2007.
The government explicitly requested the recipient not disclose the existence of the subpoena to any third party to preserve the investigation's confidentiality and prevent interference.
The subpoena demands all records for specific telephone numbers, including call details, subscriber information, text messages, and IP history.
The document indicates the investigation is being conducted by a federal grand jury in the Southern District of New York, specifically by the Child Exploitation and Human Trafficking Task Force.
